tool.name: ISP candidates
tool.description: constructs a putative list of potential i-spanin from an input genomic FASTA

param.label: Range Selection; default is all; for a specific range to check for a spanin input integers separated by a colon (eg. 1000:2000)
param.name: switch

param.label: TMD minimal distance from start codon
param.name: isp_min_dist

param.label: TMD maximum distance from start codon
param.name: isp_max_dist
param.help: Searches for a TMD between TMDmin and TMDmax ie [TMDmin,TMDmax]

tool.help:
*NOTE: This tool only takes a SINGLE genomic fasta. It does not work with multiFASTAs.*
**INPUT** --> Genomic FASTA
**METHODOLOGY**
Locates ALL potential start sequences, based on ttg / atg / gtg (M / L / V). This generates a set of "pre-output" files consisting of FASTA (nt and aa) / BED / GFF3.
With the aaFASTA, read in each potential sequence and determine if it has a TMD based off of:
1. Lysine snorkels and neighboring hydrophobic residues, within the range the user inputs. 2. A repeated hydrophobic region within the sequence ([FIWLVMYCATGSP]), within the range the user inputs. 3. Periplasmic calculations of residues. Minimal and maximum thresholds for required amount of residues after TMD is found.
**OUTPUT** --> putative_isp.fa (FASTA) file, putative_isp.gff3, and basic summary statistics as summary_isp.txt.
